result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Shamus L Wilson was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The fine is $2452.00 to include $200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid as condition of probation. Cash bond to be applied.

Not possess/consume alcohol beverages.

Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Huber privilieges subject to jail policies. Sentence may be served in Dane County.  Electronic monitoring allowed.  Good time allowed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shamus L Wilson in court with attorney Michael J. Short.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead guilty to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 2 & 3 dismissed but read in.  On Ct. 1 court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 3 years.  Conditions of probation include:  8 months jail with Huber work release, good time is available, must start by 5 pm today.  $2452.00 fines and costs.  30 month DL revocation.  30 month IID upon licensure.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  Defendant may transfer to Dane County Jail.  1 day jail credit due.  May have electronic monitoring.  Cash bond to be applied towards costs and fines.

Defendant Shamus L Wilson in court with attorney Michael J. Short.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant needs more time to work on getting Huber approved by another county.  Atty Short requested a new plea/sentencing date.  State had no objection.  Bond remains.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
